page.title: 12La Rocco Tower (1)
page.content:
{La Rocco Tower}was built on a prominent rock at the low tide mark in the middle of St Ouen's Bay. It was one a series of towers of distinctive Jersey design that were constructed between 1781 and 1800 around the island's coastline in the wake of the almost-successful French invasion of 1781. These towers are usually referred to as{Martello}towers though their design pre-dates the true Martellos by more than 20 years.
During the Second World War, the {German occupying forces,}probably more by accident than design, used the tower on the odd occasion for target practice for their big 10 cm guns. The outer courtyard walls were breached to the extent that the sea, over the following 20 years or so, was able to come{near to bringing down the tower.
